column4: can someone help me mount an NTFS drive? sudo mount -t ntfs /dev/sda1 doesn't work for me
I mean... sudo mount -t ntfs /media/sata /dev/sda1 (it says Error opening '/media/sata': Is a directory
Failed to mount '/media/sata': Is a directory
you are doing it the wrong way, exchange /media/sata and /dev...
pastebin the output of mount, please
but I'm using an old version that wont support ebox and until I can upgrade I'm stuck
its up to you, just wanted to tell you - anyway the standard port is 10000 and webmin will tell you its port right after installation
yep, I appreciate it, I'm sure as soon as I can upgrade to a NON EOL dist I'll switch, but 10000 isnt' working for me and I can't find a config that might tell me
gimme a minute
I found the config and it shows 10000 as the listen so its gotta be a firewall issue
ok, but there is a configuration option too, to tell from what IP-address you are allowed to connect
I don't see that in the config I'm pretty sure I wouldn' t have specified an ip because I'm not static
as workaround: you have ssh access, and your local machine is linux?
yeah ssh or vnc
so you can start a browser on the remote machine and try to access webmin from there
yeah just tried it, http://localhost:10000 didn't work
did you sudo /etc/init.d/webmin start?
yes I did
doin again for redundancy
have a look at the output of lsof -i
thanks for that, I see the port now. it wasn't default :P but also I forgot I had to use https
glad it worked out
where/when do you get it?
